We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our team. You will be managing and analyzing data being captured and processed across TravelPerk in order to create useful insights for strategic purposes. This is an instrumental position to bring the business to the next level, you will support our Product Teams using analytics to facilitate conversations and assist in data-informed decision-making.
 Are you ready to take off with us? Keep reading!
What you will do:

Work with other Data Analysts and other functions to use quantitative analysis to help shape TravelPerk's product and business strategy.
Explore data from different sources, turning it into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisions
Analyze data to identify and resolve problems with our products or processes, or to validate hypotheses that could lead to impactful discoveries
Develop and create metrics, dashboards, and reports to track and assess the impact of new developments and initiatives

What you need:

2+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in data analytics
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English

You will need to prove the following:

You are a Master in data analysis tools  (SQL and Excel)
Experience with statistical packages (Python / R)
Experience preparing, consolidating and normalizing data
Experience with different data visualization and BI tools (ie Looker or Tableau)
The desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individuals

 How We WorkOur Vision is for a world where TravelPerk is the platform for human connection in real life (IRL). We fundamentally believe in meeting in real life to improve connectivity, productivity, and creativity, ultimately making us a great workplace.

Design and maintain the infrastructure for design operations  workflows, tools, documentation systems  so the team can move faster and collaborate more effectively.
Build and evolve governance models for cross-functional work, documentation, QA, design system contribution, and delivery expectations.
Operationalize our design processes, rituals, and methods  ensuring they are scalable, accessible, and easy to adopt across squads and tribes.
Own and update all process-related documentation; ensure the team and leadership have clear visibility and access to what they need, when they need it

6+ years of experience in DesignOps, UX Operations, or related roles in product organizations.
2+ years of experience managing individuals or small teams.
Proven track record of building and scaling operational systems for distributed, multi-disciplinary design teams.

Hear more about TravelPerk. This isn't a typical legal role. 
As Junior Privacy & AI Counsel at TravelPerk, youll help shape the future of privacy and AI in travel and spend management tech. You will be at the crossroads of cutting-edge technology, evolving privacy and AI governance regulations, and a deeply customer-focused and innovative legal team -  making an impact from day one as TravelPerk moves toward being an AI-first company.
Your work will help us earn and keep our customers trust, while empowering teams with clear, scalable, and future-ready privacy and AI governance that drives TravelPerks growth. However, this is just the start: well provide you with the resources you need to help us consolidate a world-class data privacy and responsible AI culture for TravelPerk, and to grow your own profile as a leading professional in the privacy and AI governance spaces.  
This role sits within TravelPerks legal and privacy team. Reporting to TravelPerks Senior Privacy Manager, you will work closely with our Privacy & AI Counsel & DPO.
What will you be doing?

Contribute to resolving global legal and regulatory privacy and AI governance matters, ensuring compliance with applicable laws and regulations (GDPR, CCPA, EU AI Act, etc.).
Anticipate relevant regulatory changes in these areas and help prepare teams to confidently navigate them while maintaining compliance.
Investigate, implement, and refine privacy and AI governance policies, leveraging technology and a process-minded approach to work to improve efficiency and speed-to-market.
Develop close relationships with stakeholders across product, engineering, security, customer care, people, and marketing teams, to understand their needs and objectives and align privacy and AI governance outcomes accordingly.
Assist with product launches and updates to ensure they comply with privacy by design and responsible AI standards.
Lead and improve handling of impact assessments, data subject requests, risk reviews, incident response, PET adoption, and more.
Monitor compliance through audits, assessments, and vendor evaluations.
Track and report privacy and AI metrics, trends, and risks to senior management.
Contribute to training, communication strategies, and other resources to strengthen TravelPerks privacy and AI culture.
Proactively and holistically identify areas of risk and collaborate with relevant team members to mitigate risks effectively.

What capabilities will help you succeed in this role?

The role demands deep expertise in privacy and AI governance laws, the ability to quickly grasp complex, emerging data technologies, and a strong drive to foster global collaboration in creating innovative compliance solutions.
Candidates with between 2-4 PQE of experience of working in an in-house function or a law firm are likely to have the relevant skills/ knowledge for this position, but we will consider any applicants with relevant experience (and it is not essential that you have prior experience of working in-house).
Relevant privacy certifications, such as Certified Information Privacy Professional (CIPP), or Artificial Intelligence Governance Professional (AIGP), are also desirable.

Talented and driven people are entitled to expect employers to offer an employee value proposition which offers continual levelling up.  
A successful occupant of this role will, after a suitable period of time, have exceptional experience of working in a fast scaling, global tech (and specifically SaaS) business. He or she will develop the tools and techniques to deliver internal privacy capability at scale which subverts the expectations of stakeholders regarding privacy and AI governance laws (i.e. that it is bureaucracy) and drives tangible business outcomes.  
In terms of promotions, the next layer up from Junior Privacy & AI Counsel is Privacy & AI Counsel. We are not hiring in this layer currently, and do not expect to hire over the head of this role; instead, we are looking for this person to grow and scale capability in their areas of expertise (and among legal subject matter experts who interact with other legal and privacy roles). TravelPerk will offer you as much latitude as you want in order to deliver the best possible outcomes for your customers; and micromanagement or layers of bureaucracy are not part of that process.
The winning candidate will benefit from a competitive salary, stock options and a positive, high impact not long hours culture.
